intro: Heliophila sphaerostigma, commonly known as the globe sedge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, rounded inflorescence that resembles a globe, hence its common name. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along streams. Heliophila sphaerostigma is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments.
